basics.name: Claudiu Nicola
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer (Backend)
basics.summary: As a backend-focused professional with 8+ years of experience, my expertise lies in building scalable and easy-to-maintain cloud-native software solutions. My work has spanned industries, contributing to scalable solutions in E-commerce, Banking, FinTech, Customer Experience and Entertainment, with a recent focus on onboarding web2 users into the web3 ecosystem. Adhering to the 'You build it, you run it' philosophy, I ensure top-notch quality and accountability. While possessing a basic understanding of frontend elements, my main strength is in backend engineering, involving designing robust microservices and CI/CD processes. I also bring leadership experience, guiding small teams in collaborative environments to deliver innovative backend solutions. Grounded in Computer Science and Public Governance, my background integrates technological innovation with strategic planning.

work.summary: Working on scalable cloud-native solutions for a product focused on onboarding web2 users into the web3 ecosystem. Lead a small team and provide guidance and mentorship. Being in charge of the backend architecture, design, and product implementation.
Working on scalable cloud-native solutions for a product focused on onboarding web2 users into the web3 ecosystem.
Continue providing support for the team (few hours per month), in particular about Keycloak integration.

Part of a team that delivers scalable microservices-based solutions for a scale-up business focused on Customer Service services (chatbots). Key contributions included rewriting NodeJS services in Go (Golang), integrating Keycloak for Authentication and Authorization, System Design around event-based architecture for better scalability, and delivering new features.

Individual contributor alongside the Platform&API team. The team was responsible for delivering APIs and user interfaces used by customers in a collaborative enviroment with DevOps mindset and focus on continuous integration and delivery. Key contributions included breaking down the monolithic application into microservices, implementing OAuth2 authentication and introducing event-driven architecture for scaling purposes. I was involved in all parts of the SDLC, from planning and defining software design documents for new product features to maintenance and scaling.
highlights: Microservices, REST APIs, Serverless, CI/CD, E2E Testing, Monitorning & Observability

work.summary: Giving a helping hand for a short period of time to a small start-up. Responsible for the design and implementation of core platform features.
highlights: PHP, NodeJS, MongoDB, AngularJS, REST APIs, E2E Testing, Thid-parties integrations

work.summary: Contributed to two major project, an e-commerce that operated on the US market and a Bank Loan Managent Solution used by the biggest bank from Romania.
highlights: PHP, Javascript, Relation Databases, REST APIs, RabbitMQ, Redis

work.summary: Joined a new mentorship program inside Evozon to go deeper into the world of software development. The programâ€™s output was a Product Questions and Answers module for e-commerce websites. The module was adapted and used on real projects.
Three months focused on backend development using PHP and MySQL. The final project was a team effort that simulated a real team building a small e-commerce website.
highlights: Data Structures, PHP basics, OOP, Coding Standards
Design Patterns, MySQL, Software Development Life Cycle

volunteer.summary: Improve the digitalization level of the academic and administrative processes within Babes-Bolyai University.

Cluj Y.Tech is a community of young techies, studying in Cluj. We feel responsible for our own trajectory so for that, we study and practice software development in school plus on our own free time. We believe that we should absorb all the knowledge we can from University, but there are more knowledge, experience, and ideas out there. Cluj is a vibrant city and we should take advantage of being here! And for that, we think we can do more if we stand united!
